context: Task requests adding 'X' to README but is critically vague. The repository is a monorepo for PostHog JavaScript packages with a main README at the root and multiple package-specific READMEs. Without clarification on what 'X' refers to, which README to modify, and where/how to add it, the task cannot be confidently planned.
blockers: Task uses placeholder variable 'X' without defining what content should be added
Unclear which README should be modified (main root README or one of 7+ package READMEs)
No specification of where in the README the content should be placed
No context on the purpose or nature of the addition
Unknown if this is a documentation update, section header, link, feature description, or something else

questions.question: What specific content should be added as 'X'?
options: A new section (e.g., 'Installation', 'Quick Start', 'API Reference') - specify the section name and content
A link to external documentation or resource - specify the URL and link text
A new package reference or feature list item - specify what package/feature and description

questions.question: Which README file should be modified?
options: Root README.md (monorepo overview) - applies to all packages
A specific package README (posthog-js, posthog-node, etc.) - specify which package
All package READMEs - same content added to each

questions.question: Where in the README should 'X' be placed?
options: In a new section (specify section title and approximate position)
Within an existing section like 'Documentation', 'Contributing', or 'Description'
